title: Out of her Shroud. [A novel.]
author: Ochiltree, Henry.
snippet: " To the town of Hilltown ? Then it is clear you can't go there to-night—fifteen miles good, and what is more, sir, you have to pass through the valley of Drool. Impossible, sir! Why, you will never reach Hilltown if you enter Drool Valley this night, I could wager all my hens and pigeons.

title: Out of her Shroud. [A novel.]
author: Ochiltree, Henry.
snippet: " To the town of Hilltown ? Then it is clear you can't go there to-night—fifteen miles good, and what is more, sir, you have to pass through the valley of Drool. Impossible, sir! Why, you will never reach Hilltown if you enter Drool Valley this night, I could wager all my hens and pigeons. No man ever gets clear through Drool that enters at night, I can tell you.

title: Out of her Shroud. [A novel.]
author: Ochiltree, Henry.
snippet: " Frae the auld toon o' Embro, and am bound for Hilltown, though, faith, I fear I'll be sair flegged to reach there this nicht."

title: Out of her Shroud. [A novel.]
author: Ochiltree, Henry.
snippet: And neither she was. Nobody at Hilltown has ever seen her again. The more was the pity, for she was very beautiful.

title: Out of her Shroud. [A novel.]
author: Ochiltree, Henry.
snippet: " Oh no, it is all well past; but I'm not thinking of corn to-night. I am but a lone traveller on the way to the town of Hilltown."

title: Out of her Shroud. [A novel.]
author: Ochiltree, Henry.
snippet: " I mind well, it was the end o' spring—a frosty night, for a' it was so near the summer. A lady knocked at this door, asking the road for Hilltown. We a' tried to persuade her not to go, but she wouldna be moved.

title: Out of her Shroud. [A novel.]
author: Ochiltree, Henry.
snippet: Well, now, did you ever hear anything like this? Here is a gentleman who proposes to go to Hilltown through Drool Valley.

title: Tours in Scotland 1677 & 1681. By T. Kirk and R. Thoresby. Edited by P. Hume Brown
author: Kirk, Thomas
